results.title: Sue and Mario: the Italian Australians
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
An introduction to the hybrid lifestyles resulting from the marriage of two second-generation Australians of different ethnic origins. Both Sue and Mario are second generation Australians. Sue’s family migrated from England, whilst Mario’s came from Italy. The couple live in Griffith, a N.S.W. rural community where more than fifty per cent of the population is of Italian descent. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Flo and Marianna: a matter of language
results.creator_credit: Linda Blagg, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Depicts the plight of aged migrant people living alone. In Marianna’s case, Flo, the Australian next door - “takes her up”, showing her own attitudes towards migrants in the process. Credits include: Camera by Tony Wilson; sound by Rodney Simmons.

results.title: Sadek: speaking English
results.creator_credit: Michael Robertson, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A biographical account of an Egyptian migrant, Sadek. The film discusses the adult education classes he attends, and the problems he has to face with his limited knowledge of English Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Maria going home
results.creator_credit: Tom Manefield, Debby Kingsland and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Maria, originally from Spain, has been in Australia some fifteen years - half her life. In the film she and her family discuss plans to return to Spain. The film is intended to show why a family, materially and professionally successful in Australia and with two Australian born children might choose to uproot themselves a second time.

results.description:

results.title: Tempted
results.creator_credit: Bill Bennett, Larry Katz, David Kronemyer, Jennifer Cluff, TFI International and Golden Circle Films
results.brief_description: Written, produced and directed by Australian filmmaker Bill Bennett (“Kiss or Kill”) this erotic thriller set in Louisiana, New Orleans, explores the boundaries of fidelity and friendship. A wealthy businessman Charlie (Burt Reynolds) pays a young carpenter, Jimmy (Peter Facinelli), who is under his employ to try and seduce his wife, offering to pay him $10,000 for the attempt and a further $40,000 if he can identify a ‘mark’ hidden on her body. Although he swears not to tell anyone about the offer Jimmy confides in his best friend, showing him the photograph of the young and beautiful wife Lilly (Saffron Burrows). Not trusting his wife or Jimmy, Charlie uses the services of a private detective to wire his house and obtain video evidence of any possible sexual encounters. As it is the steamy South, guns, intrigue and murder ensue as Lilly finds out about the deal and goes ahead with the affair. Great original music composed by David Bridie adds to the swampy New Orleans locations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Bennett, Larry Katz, David Kronemyer, Jennifer Cluff, TFI International and Golden Circle Films
results.description: Written, produced and directed by Australian filmmaker Bill Bennett (“Kiss or Kill”) this erotic thriller set in Louisiana, New Orleans, explores the boundaries of fidelity and friendship. A wealthy businessman Charlie (Burt Reynolds) pays a young carpenter, Jimmy (Peter Facinelli), who is under his employ to try and seduce his wife, offering to pay him $10,000 for the attempt and a further $40,000 if he can identify a ‘mark’ hidden on her body. Although he swears not to tell anyone about the offer Jimmy confides in his best friend, showing him the photograph of the young and beautiful wife Lilly (Saffron Burrows). Not trusting his wife or Jimmy, Charlie uses the services of a private detective to wire his house and obtain video evidence of any possible sexual encounters. As it is the steamy South, guns, intrigue and murder ensue as Lilly finds out about the deal and goes ahead with the affair. Great original music composed by David Bridie adds to the swampy New Orleans locations.
description_for_label: Written, produced and directed by Australian filmmaker Bill Bennett (“Kiss or Kill”) this erotic thriller set in Louisiana, New Orleans, explores the boundaries of fidelity and friendship. A wealthy businessman Charlie (Burt Reynolds) pays a young carpenter, Jimmy (Peter Facinelli), who is under his employ to try and seduce his wife, offering to pay him $10,000 for the attempt and a further $40,000 if he can identify a ‘mark’ hidden on her body. Although he swears not to tell anyone about the offer Jimmy confides in his best friend, showing him the photograph of the young and beautiful wife Lilly (Saffron Burrows). Not trusting his wife or Jimmy, Charlie uses the services of a private detective to wire his house and obtain video evidence of any possible sexual encounters. As it is the steamy South, guns, intrigue and murder ensue as Lilly finds out about the deal and goes ahead with the affair. Great original music composed by David Bridie adds to the swampy New Orleans locations.

results.title: Breathe
results.creator_credit: Yan Wawrzynczak, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Yan Wawrzynczak weaves a moving story about a man, the woman he fell in love with and their child. Over several continents and many years, Wawrzynczak covers the changing seasons of this relationship as the three move in and out of each other’s lives.
